summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a call from a woman identifying as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses her attempts to contact authorities, her previous representation by an attorney for the Victim Fund, and the office's prior unsuccessful attempts to contact victims through that attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the perpetrator by a woman who called the U.S. Attorney's Office claiming to be his former victim.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the initial email, reporting on a call from an Epstein victim and detailing prior communications with the victim's attorney.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is part of the office receiving information and attempting to follow up on a case involving Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein victim calls U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: A woman named (name redacted) called the U.S. Attorney's Office, identified herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein, and provided her contact information.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Office contacts victim's attorney
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office was in touch with an attorney (Mr. [redacted]) who claimed to represent at least nine Epstein victims, all reportedly unwilling to speak with prosecutors.

keyFacts: A woman identifying as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein directly contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in February 2021.
The victim stated she had been represented by an attorney for the Epstein Victim Fund but was not currently represented, and had previously contacted an NYPD detective.
The U.S. Attorney's Office had prior contact in 2020 with an attorney who claimed to represent multiple Epstein victims who were unwilling to speak with prosecutors.
Key names of the victim and her attorney are redacted in the document text.
